intro: Patagonium asperum, commonly known as the rough patagonia, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to the harsh climate of Patagonia. Its leaves are rough and hairy, providing protection against strong winds and intense sunlight. Patagonium asperum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
